title: How to Make Pizza Cups

methods.name: Preparing Pizza Cups Made with Wonton Wrappers

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
steps.description: Turn the oven on to 350 degrees (176°C). While the oven is preheating, prepare your ingredients. Set out your wonton skins, pizza sauce, mozzarella cheese, and choice of toppings.

steps.headline: Press the wonton wrappers into a muffin pan.
steps.description: You can use 24 wonton wrappers, or use more if you have more ingredients. Press each wonton wrapper into the spaces of the muffin tin. Make sure that the edges of the wrappers do not curl in.

steps.headline: Bake for seven minutes.
steps.description: Put the pan with the wonton wrappers in the oven. Bake the wrappers for seven minutes. Remove after seven minutes when the wrappers are firm.

steps.headline: Fill the cups with marinara sauce and toppings.
steps.description: Fill each wonton wrapper with one teaspoon of marinara sauce (or any other kind of pizza sauce). Then, filled the wrappers with the ingredients of your choice. You can choose ingredients like sausage, pepperoni, mushrooms, and onions. Sprinkle a generous amount of shredded cheese on top of the ingredients. Make sure ingredients, like sausage, has been cooked before putting them in the wonton cups.

steps.headline: Bake for 7-10 more minutes.
steps.description: Once all of the ingredients are in the wonton wrappers, put the muffin pan back in the oven. Bake the pizza cups for seven to ten minutes on 350°F (176°C) until the cheese has melted. Remove from oven and serve warm.

methods.name: Cooking Pizza Cups Made with Crescent Roll Dough

steps.headline: Prepare the dough.
steps.description: Use two tubes of refrigerated crescent roll dough. Open each tube and separate the dough into eight rolls for each tube. Then, halve the rolls. Press the halved rolls into a muffin pan. Make sure the muffin pan has been coated with cooking spray before putting the dough into each section.

steps.headline: Spoon pizza sauce into the dough.
steps.description: Put one teaspoon (4.9 mL) of pizza sauce into each dough cup. You can use slightly less or more depending on the size and depth of the dough cups.

steps.headline: Top with ingredients.
steps.description: This recipe calls for two ounces of sliced turkey pepperoni, ¼ cups of finely chopped onions, and a 1/3 cup of finely chopped green pepper. You can, however, use whatever ingredients you’d like. Put the ingredients of your choice in the cups and top with one cup of mozzarella cheese distributed evenly over the cups.

steps.headline: Bake for 15-18 minutes.
steps.description: Once all of the ingredients are in the dough cups, put the muffin pan in the oven. Bake them for 15-18 minutes at 375°F (190°C). The crusts should be browned, and the cheese should be melted when they are done baking. Remove the pan from the oven and serve while warm.

methods.name: Preparing Pizza Cups Made with French Loaf Dough

steps.headline: Preheat the oven and prepare the muffin tin.
steps.description: Turn the oven on to 350°F (176°C). While the oven is preheating, lightly mist your muffin pan with cooking spray. You can also wipe a small amount of cooking oil onto the pan if you don’t have a spray.

steps.headline: Cook ingredients.
steps.description: This recipe calls for 2.5 (70.8 g) ounces of diced mushrooms and 20 slices of sliced turkey pepperoni, but you can use any ingredients that you’d like. If you choose to use mushrooms and turkey pepperoni, first cook the mushrooms in a small skillet for a few minutes until wilted/browned. Then, put the pepperoni and mushroom slices in a bowl with one can of pizza sauce. Stir the ingredients together.

steps.headline: Prepare the dough.
steps.description: Lay the French bread dough onto a clean, dry surface. Use a sharp knife to cut the dough into eight rounds. Then, press the rounds into three to four inch rounds with your hands or a rolling pin. Press the rounds into the muffin pan, forming dough cups.

steps.headline: Distribute the ingredients.
steps.description: Pour the mixed ingredients into each dough cup using a spoon. Make sure that the ingredients are distributed evenly. Then, sprinkle a generous amount of mozzarella cheese on top of the ingredients. Finish with a pinch of Italian seasoning onto each cup.

steps.headline: Bake for 16-18 minutes.
steps.description: Put the muffin pan in the oven and bake for 16-18 minutes. The oven should have been already preheated to 350°F (176°C). Bake until the edges are brown and crusty. Then, remove the pan and allow to cool for three to five minutes before serving.

text: Preparing Pizza Cups Made with Wonton Wrappers Preheat the oven to 350°F. Turn the oven on to 350 degrees (176°C). While the oven is preheating, prepare your ingredients. Set out your wonton skins, pizza sauce, mozzarella cheese, and choice of toppings. Press the wonton wrappers into a muffin pan. You can use 24 wonton wrappers, or use more if you have more ingredients. Press each wonton wrapper into the spaces of the muffin tin. Make sure that the edges of the wrappers do not curl in. Bake for seven minutes. Put the pan with the wonton wrappers in the oven. Bake the wrappers for seven minutes. Remove after seven minutes when the wrappers are firm. Fill the cups with marinara sauce and toppings. Fill each wonton wrapper with one teaspoon of marinara sauce (or any other kind of pizza sauce). Then, filled the wrappers with the ingredients of your choice. You can choose ingredients like sausage, pepperoni, mushrooms, and onions. Sprinkle a generous amount of shredded cheese on top of the ingredients. Make sure ingredients, like sausage, has been cooked before putting them in the wonton cups. Bake for 7-10 more minutes. Once all of the ingredients are in the wonton wrappers, put the muffin pan back in the oven. Bake the pizza cups for seven to ten minutes on 350°F (176°C) until the cheese has melted. Remove from oven and serve warm. Cooking Pizza Cups Made with Crescent Roll Dough Prepare the dough. Use two tubes of refrigerated crescent roll dough. Open each tube and separate the dough into eight rolls for each tube. Then, halve the rolls. Press the halved rolls into a muffin pan. Make sure the muffin pan has been coated with cooking spray before putting the dough into each section. Spoon pizza sauce into the dough. Put one teaspoon (4.9 mL) of pizza sauce into each dough cup. You can use slightly less or more depending on the size and depth of the dough cups. Top with ingredients. This recipe calls for two ounces of sliced turkey pepperoni, ¼ cups of finely chopped onions, and a 1/3 cup of finely chopped green pepper. You can, however, use whatever ingredients you’d like. Put the ingredients of your choice in the cups and top with one cup of mozzarella cheese distributed evenly over the cups. Bake for 15-18 minutes. Once all of the ingredients are in the dough cups, put the muffin pan in the oven. Bake them for 15-18 minutes at 375°F (190°C). The crusts should be browned, and the cheese should be melted when they are done baking. Remove the pan from the oven and serve while warm. Preparing Pizza Cups Made with French Loaf Dough Preheat the oven and prepare the muffin tin. Turn the oven on to 350°F (176°C). While the oven is preheating, lightly mist your muffin pan with cooking spray. You can also wipe a small amount of cooking oil onto the pan if you don’t have a spray. Cook ingredients. This recipe calls for 2.5 (70.8 g) ounces of diced mushrooms and 20 slices of sliced turkey pepperoni, but you can use any ingredients that you’d like. If you choose to use mushrooms and turkey pepperoni, first cook the mushrooms in a small skillet for a few minutes until wilted/browned. Then, put the pepperoni and mushroom slices in a bowl with one can of pizza sauce. Stir the ingredients together. Prepare the dough. Lay the French bread dough onto a clean, dry surface. Use a sharp knife to cut the dough into eight rounds. Then, press the rounds into three to four inch rounds with your hands or a rolling pin. Press the rounds into the muffin pan, forming dough cups. Distribute the ingredients. Pour the mixed ingredients into each dough cup using a spoon. Make sure that the ingredients are distributed evenly. Then, sprinkle a generous amount of mozzarella cheese on top of the ingredients. Finish with a pinch of Italian seasoning onto each cup. Bake for 16-18 minutes. Put the muffin pan in the oven and bake for 16-18 minutes. The oven should have been already preheated to 350°F (176°C). Bake until the edges are brown and crusty. Then, remove the pan and allow to cool for three to five minutes before serving.
